Created an attachment (id=65974)
Fix by sending "Unchanged" for files unmodified since a conflict

I got the same failure with cvs-1.11.22-6.fc6 on Fedora Core 6 and investigated:

When Eclipse tries to commit the conflicted file, it correctly sends an entry line containing "+=" to tell the server the file was not modified since the conflict.  It also says "Modified" and sends the file contents, which appears to make the server accept the file despite the "+=" indication.  Command-line cvs says "Unchanged" and doesn't send the contents, and the server rejects the file.

The attached patch makes Eclipse send "Unchanged" without contents for files unmodified since a conflict.  That fixes this test failure without causing any others, but of course it might not be the best fix, and I wonder if there are be operations other than committing for which sending "Unchanged" in this case causes a problem.

Created an attachment (id=65977)
Log of Eclipse committing to CVS server despite conflict

This is a log of the communication betweeen Eclipse and the CVS server during the failing test case, showing the conflicted file getting committed.

Created an attachment (id=65978)
Log of command-line CVS not committing to CVS server

I made a similar setup with the command-line CVS and tried to commit a file that was unmodified since a conflict.  This log shows the CVS server rejecting the file.

traces.message: should not be allowed to commit a resource with merged conflicts
